title: Little League coach pleads guilty to stealing $4,300 from the organization
text:
The former president of Forest Grove Little League Softball pleaded guilty last week to charges that he spent $4,365 of the league's money on non-league purchases.
Esteban "Steve" Aleman, 38, pleaded guilty to two counts of theft Sept. 21 in the Washington County Circuit Court. He turned himself in to police in July after learning a five-month investigation had yielded probable cause for his arrest.
Esteban Aleman, 38, pleaded guilty Sept. 21, 2015, to embezzling about $4,300 from Forest Grove Little League Softball. Forest Grove Police Department The Oregonian/OregonLive Forest Grove detectives began the investigation in March after the league board notified them of unusual charges on its credit card, which Aleman had sole access to.
Forest Grove Police Capt. Mike Herb said in July that the suspicious charges included ATM withdrawals, a utility bill and equipment for a separate youth softball league Aleman was involved with.
At the time Aleman turned himself in, current League President Greg Peters said the missing money was about a third of the league's annual budget.
Aleman is now on an 18-month probation and required to complete 80 hours of community service. He's been ordered to repay the league in full, along with a smattering of other fees to the court. Sentencing documents note that if the money is not paid back, Aleman "will go to jail for a substantial period of time."
